headline: Edith Kunhardt Davis, Writer of Sequels to Her Mother’s ‘Pat the Bunny,’ Dies at 82
abstract: She also wrote about the death of her son at 27, for which she blamed herself because she had been an alcoholic when she was pregnant with him.
lead_paragraph: Edith Kunhardt Davis had an idyllic childhood, growing up on a big, if run-down, estate in rural New Jersey. Her mother, Dorothy Kunhardt, a famous author of children’s books, wrote — just for Edith — “Pat the Bunny,” a 1940 novelty that had movable parts and invited young readers to touch and feel the textures on its pages. It remains one of the best-selling children’s books of all time.
